alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Van Buren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 4:28PM CDT until March 31 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT FOR WESTERN VAN BUREN...SOUTHEASTERN KEOKUK...SOUTHWESTERN WASHINGTON...JEFFERSON AND SCOTLAND COUNTIES... At 428 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Wellman to near Kilwinning, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Azen, Cantril, Lake Sugema Campground, Lebanon, Keosauqua, Lacey Keosauqua State Park, Keosauqua Airport, Van Buren County Fairgrounds, Mount Zion, Kilbourn and Birmingham. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for southeastern Iowa...and northeastern Missouri.
